item.title: Making locally relevant stories using PPP loans and scripting
item.description: On Monday, the Small Business Administration released the names of some 650,000 Paycheck Protection Program loans given to businesses during the pandemic. Big news organizations went into action, finding the politcally connected who got loans, interesting businesses who got them and even some irony in the data. But for very small organizations, who don’t have data desks and investigative units, the data wasn’t particularly useful. For small town newspapers, local companies getting PPP loans is an interesting story, but most of them lack the resources to go diving into a 127 MB spreadsheet.
